system_overview: An interactive web artifact exposing the double bind of AI disclosure mandates: sophisticated AI use becomes harder to report as it becomes more valuable, creating structural incentives for either misrepresentation or self-censorship.

mindsets_paradigms.current: Disclosure = itemized confession of AI 'prompts used'
mindsets_paradigms.target: Disclosure = visible process trail during work
mindsets_paradigms.intervention: Demonstrate paradox so vividly that paradigm shift becomes necessary

organizing_principles.current: ACM policy treats AI as discrete tool, not thought partner
organizing_principles.intervention: Create vocabulary for 'symbiotic use' vs 'transactional use'

information_flows.current: Instructors see only post-hoc reports, not actual collaboration patterns
information_flows.target: Trail visible during work (like pair programming metrics)
information_flows.intervention: Trail-aware tools that show process, not just product

system_infrastructure.current: LLM conversations ephemeral; no persistent collaboration record

dynamic_processes.embedded_values: ACM policies assume knowledge production is individual; AI = cheating risk
dynamic_processes.process_redesign_opportunity: Disclosure as observation during work, not confession after

social_positionalities.power_dynamics: Students have low power to critique disclosure mandates; instructors hold legibility power
social_positionalities.safety_concerns: Undergrads may not risk critique that PhD students can
social_positionalities.legitimized_expertise: Policies favor 'legitimate' (minimal, tidy) AI use over sophisticated collaboration

invisible_work.articulation_labor: Translating disclosure anxiety into intellectual problem
invisible_work.emotional_labor: Managing 'sword of Damocles' feeling all semester
invisible_work.unrecognized_labor: Prompt engineering, iteration, dead ends—invisible in final disclosure

embedded_systems.policies: Academic integrity frameworks treating AI as cheating vector
embedded_systems.economic_logics: LLM providers benefit from 'legitimate use' framing

integrated_intervention_strategies.intervention: Create Disclosure Theatre interface demonstrating the double bind
integrated_intervention_strategies.infrastructure_work: Build artifact that exposes structural problem; provide vocabulary (mētis vs techne, symbiotic vs transactional)

integrated_intervention_strategies.intervention: Write critical disclosure statement in final project
integrated_intervention_strategies.infrastructure_work: Use assignment submission itself as soft resistance; piggyback on required disclosure format
Build network of students + instructors + STS scholars who recognize the problem

invisible_trail: Week 1 disclosure anxiety crystallizing into intellectual problem
Decision to make anxiety itself the subject

meta_rule: Analyze disclosure systems by asking: What paradigm governs what counts as 'honest' AI use, AND what infrastructural conditions (policies, power dynamics, invisible labor) make certain disclosures possible and others illegible?
